task_summary: Robot arm picks up a red cylinder from the table surface.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a robotic manipulator on a tabletop workspace. The main goal is to locate a red cylindrical object amongst several blue objects, approach it, and successfully pick it up off the table. The robot relies on its vision system for perception before executing a stable grasp. Contact feedback is used to guide the grasp and verify success. The episode demonstrates a standard pick step as part of broader pick-and-place workflows, emphasizing reliability and adaptation to object pose.
preconditions: Red cylinder (target object) present and unobstructed on table.
Robot at home or idle pose; gripper open.
stepwise_plan: Visually search and verify visibility of the red cylinder.
Detect/refine pose of the red object.
Compute top grasp pose for the object.
Approach and align to the target with tight tolerance.
Lower until contact with specified force threshold.
success_criteria: Red object is firmly grasped by the gripper.
Object is raised above table level.
No slippage or dropping detected during lifting.
failure_and_recovery: Object not visible: retry scan up to 3 times.
Pose estimation errors: fallback to re-detection.
Grip fails or insufficient force: repeat approach or grasp.
Contact not detected: verify and reapproach.
task_long_description.termination: Episode ends once red object is securely lifted from table surface.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red cylinder is visible to perception.
Scans workspace with spiral pattern to locate red cylinder.
Detects precise pose of red cylinder using vision.
Opens gripper to 6cm width with fast actuation.
Moves end-effector above the red cylinder by 5cm.
Computes a top grasp pose for the red cylinder.
Approaches and aligns with target using tight 5mm tolerance.
Lowers gripper until gentle contact detected (<5N, slow speed, max 5cm).
Closes gripper with 10N force for reliable grasp.
Checks if grasped object is stably held.
Raises the held object by 10cm above table.

recovery_strategy: Retry scan up to 3 times if object unseen.
Fallback to re-detection if pose unreliable.
Repeat approach or grasp if stability not achieved.
Tune force and approach tolerances as needed.
assumptions: Red object is a cylinder (not ambiguous in frames).
Instruction refers to red cylinder rather than blue objects.
No evidence for 'place' step; only 'pick' is validated in frames.
Robot gripper compatible with cylindrical grasp strategy.
Blue objects (rectangle/square) are ignored per instruction.

expected_success_criteria: Red cylinder held securely by gripper and lifted >5cm above table.
